Topic.Title: All-out-war

Message.Msg: "Those of Jackson's words that were mentioned, were in regards to the point that the criteria to conduct war not be on policy." A peace-nik lacks understanding as to when to fight a war or why, which is why the term is apt for the Judge Jackson in question. Such a person also "does not know how wars are won" as the very reason for their being a peace-nik is to avoid the realities of what it takes to win a war. Your Judge Jackson does not understand when to fight, how to fight, or why to fight. His attitudes on policy are useless, and the US's record of defeats or costly draws since he uttered his words does not support their value. His attitude is natural to members of the academic elite of the conquering power though. The victory that gave him the luxury to make his impractical and useless remarks was not won by his philosophy but rather by the fire-boming of cities, an act deliberately aimed at civilians, especially so in places like Dresden where the fires were stoked to turn the city into the equivalent of a blast furnace, or in Tokyo where special bombs were selected to start a firestorm. The nuclear bombing raids were not much different. The US also rounded up up minorities in camps when it saw fit, and injected mental patients with plutonium to see what would happen, and engaged in many other things the conqueror try very hard to expunge from the record. Yet again you cling to the irrelevant date of 1506. Yes, Machiavelli led the Florentine defense and was building up its army that year. He got a chance to bring the army he was responsible for into combat a couple years later and was victorious. What does that prove? It proves nothing except that he managed to win a victory. The discussion is not about military commanders or the organization of armies but about states and "Princes" (or Presidents). Machiavelli was neither a prince, nor a President, nor a head of state of any kind. If the topic was the Medici your irrelevant date would begin to have meaning, but even then it is poorly picked. The conduct of this or that "Prince" or Princes that failed to understand the art of war and lost, is not important to the discussion. Those that failed to form solid states could be expected to lose just as Machiavelli's book indicates. You obviously lack the knowledge to back up your other asinine remarks. Pathetic, as always...

Topic.Title: All-out-war

Message.Msg: "Supreme Court Justice Robert L. Jackson, U.S. Representative to the International Conference on Military Trials, "Statement by Justice Jackson on War Trials Agreement," August 12, 1945 (Department of State Bulletin) -- "We must make clear to the Germans that the wrong for which their fallen leaders are on trial is not that they lost the war, but that they started it." Your statement that his statement has nothing to with the Germans is factually, and quite obviously a deliberate lie. His is attempting to put the Germans on trial for starting the war as per his opinion that aggressive war is not a legitimate tool of foreign policy. He is entitled to his opinion, but his assertion of it is not evidence of its value, especially not from a citizen of the United States, and especially not one as educated as Judge Jackson. The fact is the United States engaged in aggressive war against England in the war of 1812 and invaded Canada. It engaged in aggressive war against the Cherokee nation and other Indian tribes of the Southeastern United States, and West. In the case of the Cherokee it marched a people off their lands in defiance of A Supreme Court ruling, using the threat of aggressive war and coercive means in violation of law to advance its national aims. It engaged in aggressive war against Mexico several times as and when it suited it. The think pretext it used to invade Mexico and seize half of it does not speak well for the any unique "Just War" moral principles of the United States. It engaged in aggressive war against Spain seizing Cuba, Puerto Rico, and the Philippines. It engaged in aggressive war against the civilian population of the Philippines, killing hundreds of thousands in its efforts to subdue it. It engaged in aggressive war, or more precisely the threat of it, when it seized Panama. Judge Jackson's remarks are entirely hypocritical coming from the Chief U.S. Prosecutor at the Nuremberg Trials, the one who aims to put the Germans on trial for starting an aggressive war. The U.S. was not built on his philosophy but by methods exactly opposite to it. The subject of the Nuremberg Trials was, however, the conduct of war, not whether aggressive war was justified no matter what your Judge Jackson says. No doubt your Judge Jackson's intent was to confound the legitimate right of a sovereign power to start an aggressive war with its conduct as he had no basis to make his claim against aggressive war, but a sound one on German conduct during the war. I'm not interested in playing trivial pursuit with you. 1506 is irrelevant to the development of Western civilization, the countries that constitute, or its extremely militaristic bellicose nature. It did not acquire those traits in 1506 and they became even more pronounced and it even more violent and bellicose in subsequent years. The military revolution and the professionalization of war had not even begun. That would begin in the 17th century... Your discussion is worthless...

Message.Title: Obama: I Just Don't Get It
Message.Msg: We've just completed 4 years with Barak Obama as president and he's neck-and-neck in the polls with Romney. After 4 years, we have un-employment stuck well above 8%... ... we're running massive, $1.2 Trillion (with a "T", Virginia) annual deficits... ... The economy is barely growing more than 1%... it's effectively stalled out... ... government spending is increasing exponentially and the only idea Obama has to cut the deficit is to raise taxes on the rich... which would only cut about 1/16 of it... > businesses have stopped hiring > Ratings agencies have lowered the credit quality of US Treasuries... for the FIRST TIME > Obamacare hugely expands the size of government and most Americans oppose it. I DON'T GET IT... WHY is this presidential race even COMPETITIVE? Could it be simply that the top 1% of U.S. earners (who provide 39% of federal tax revenues) are being totally overwhelmed by the bottom 49% of U.S. earners (who collectively pay no income tax and provide no federal tax revenues)?... ... isn't that what's been happening in Venezuela? Hugo Chavez of Venezuela and Raul Castro of Cuba have both said they support Obama... ... are THOSE the endorsements we should pay heed to? If we really CARED about the future we're leaving for our children... then would we elect Obama and let him do this to us for ANOTHER 4 YEARS?

Topic.Title: All-out-war

Message.Msg: Machiavelli is a brilliant political philosopher. I do not think his reputation is in any danger. His work will go on being taught for another 500 years at least, just as it was for the past 500. Millions of influential political leaders have read and incorporated his ideas into their own over the years. Hundreds of philosophers, political scientists, and historians have buttressed his ideas with even more support. Arrogant leftist imbeciles do not believe in such things as wisdom acquired through experience, which is the purpose of historical analysis. (if the do engage in historical analysis the typical method is to telescoping present liberal ideas backwards, distorting the historical record) They take their own opinions as facts and truths, rather like Barack Obama does when he decides he can make law through executive orders, or concoct policies in areas such as energy or taxation that many, many years of experience indicates will not work. Such arrogant liberal fools are naturally quite surprised when their "innovations" fail. The liberal fools are quite lucky everyone does not think as they do, and blindly ignore the past. If they did there is no way it would be possible to get anyone to buy the mountain of Treasury debt the U.S. is accumulating. They are not buying that based on any belief in Barack Obama's ability to guide the economy to a recovery. The expectation is that the past ability of Americans to succeed will be repeated in the future. Implicitly they assume that Obama will be gone some day and things will get better - somehow.

He equates extending unemployment benefits (and extending them to less than what we have now) to writing checks to pay off Dem/Obama contributers and gov't take over of entire (or nearly entiree) industries. While he is much better in his presentations, he is still just using phony strawman arguments. Facts are facts. But when you then choose to interpret them and spin them you have moved well outside the factual state.

Topic.Title: List of the board's biggest idiots:

Message.Msg: If we were, we would have to be the most talented poster ever. Our styles are so disparate and yet we never mess up in style or our differences in substance (because guess what, we don't agree on everything.) As to the upcoming elections. While I certainly hope Romney wins (I likely will not vote for him but he will still win my state), I have never come close to saying Obama has no chance. The inherent advantages that come with incumbancy are always difficult to overcome. The previous two Presidents proved that.

Topic.Title: Economic Growth Is Unsustainable

Message.Msg: "Impossibility statements are the very foundation of science. It is impossible to: travel faster than the speed of light; create or destroy matter-energy; build a perpetual motion machine, etc. By respecting impossibility theorems we avoid wasting resources on projects that are bound to fail. Therefore economists should be very interested in impossibility theorems, especially the one to be demonstrated here, namely that it is impossible for the world economy to grow its way out of poverty and environmental degradation. In other words, sustainable growth is impossible." http://www.jayhanson.us/page37.htm

Topic.Title: XOM Wobbling like a Fish out of Water. Shorts in there..

Message.Msg: I think this is a great resource for any one looking for good reliable information. Don't listen to the bashers, get your own information and make your own educated decisions.

Topic.Title: Big, Fat, LIAR!

Message.Msg: 1. Where did I call Krugmann a liar? You yes, him not yet. 2. I already deconstructed his myth breaking about Ryan. He is now doing the same with Christie. 3. he claims the bail out of the auto biz is what turned around Michigan. Even if this is/were true, at over $100K per job saved (using the admins numbers, which could easily be proven bogus themselves) I am not sure it was such a very good investment anyway. 4. While it may not be as populare (and personally I would prefer the gov't stay out of all such deals) at least there is a chance (maybe even already has happened) that the state will profit from it help to private enterprises. OTOH, another gov't operated tunnel to NYC will only be an ongoing costs for NJ to support. Even where such to become profitable, those $'s would not flow to NJ. 5. Krugmann also equates taxcredits reduced to taxes paid. Taxes paid are revenue to the gov't. Tax Credits are COSTS to the gov't . Thus reducing credits does NOT generate revenue but lowers costs. Q.E.D a credit reduction is not a tax. If I stop handing you money, I am not making you pay more. I am just cutting your off the dole. Which depending on circumstances, may or may not be a good (and more important but harder to define fair) thing to do. There are plenty of people (but not all) getting gov't handouts that should not be getting such. Would you like to refure more of his strawman arguments and OPINIONS? You might continue to agree with his opinions over mine. I would be surprised if not. But that doesn't make his opinions facts like you like to claim.

Topic.Title: Big, Fat, LIAR!

Message.Msg: btw wallboard, I am leaving now. So feel free to post some idiotic claim and come back in an hour (when I have not seen it) and claim I am dodgin. I might see it tomorrow or later and take the time to rip it apart. But it won't happen tonight. Good Night to you V.I.
